entries.title: Zelensky claims about 2,000 square kilometers of Ukraine retaken this month
'Tell me when this happened before': Franken presses GOP strategist on SCOTUS
entries.description: Former Democratic Sen. Al Franken debates CNN political commentator and GOP strategist Alice Stewart over the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade and the political leanings of the court.

entries.title: Aer Lingus cancels all flights from Dublin Airport due to IT breakdown
entries.description: Aer Lingus canceled all flights scheduled to depart from its Dublin Airport hub that were bound for European and the United Kingdom because of a computer malfunction. The carrier said outage affected 51 flights.

entries.title: A Black pastor arrested while watering his neighbor's flowers has filed a federal lawsuit
entries.description: Attorneys for Michael Jennings, a Black pastor arrested while watering his neighbor's flowers, filed a lawsuit in federal court on Friday alleging that the three Childersburg, Alabama, police officers who arrested him violated his rights under the First and Fourth amendments.

entries.title: Phoenix police share chilling new video of shooting rampage
entries.description: Phoenix Police released surveillance footage from a fatal Phoenix rampage involving a 24-year-old gunman who fired hundreds of rounds, killing two people and injuring five others -- including two police officers

entries.title: VP Harris sharpens attacks on Republicans: 'We refuse to let extremist, so-called leaders dismantle our democracy'
entries.description: Vice President Kamala Harris sharpened her attacks against Republicans on Saturday at the Democratic National Committee summer meeting, while also touting Democratic accomplishments since she and President Joe Biden took office.

entries.title: William and Harry seen together for the first time since June
William and Harry seen together for the first time in public since June
entries.description: • Queen Elizabeth II's funeral arrangements announced

entries.title: Russian Defense Ministry says forces in Kharkiv were told to redirect to Donetsk and 'regroup'
Kyiv's troops enter key city of Izium, officials say, as Russian military announces they're leaving Kharkiv region 'temporarily'
Ukrainian official says Russian troops' 'main artery' through Kharkiv region is severed
Funeral for Queen Elizabeth II to be held September 19
entries.description: The state funeral for Britain's Queen Elizabeth II will take place a week from Monday at Westminster Abbey, and she will lie in state in Westminster Hall from Wednesday, Buckingham Palace has announced.

entries.title: King Charles III pledges rest of his life to monarchy as he is proclaimed King
entries.description: King Charles III dedicated "what remains to me of my life" to "the heavy task that has been laid upon me" after he was formally confirmed as the new king of the United Kingdom in a ceremony steeped in tradition and pageantry at St. James's Palace on Saturday.

entries.title: Cave discovery shakes up our understanding of the Stone Age
entries.description: Many people are familiar with the African roots of the human family tree.

entries.title: British Prime Minister Liz Truss called for end of the monarchy in 1994
entries.description: CNN's Michael Smerconish breaks down how much different generations of British citizens support the monarchy and what new British Prime Minister Liz Truss said about the monarchy in the past.

entries.title: We really do want to worry, darling -- just not about what you think
entries.description: Hunger is a sly thing. Sometimes, it announces itself ostentatiously -- a stomach growling or a mouth watering at the scent drifting out of a neighbor's kitchen. On other occasions, we don't truly appreciate its urgency until we take our first, long-overdue bite of pasta dripping with sauce. The "Don't Worry, Darling" drama that's dominated the Hollywood news cycle for the last fortnight is just such a dish, and to judge by the fervor with which we've devoured every morsel, we were starving for

entries.title: First renditions of 'God Save the King' sung at sports venues as tributes to the Queen continue
entries.description: For the first time in 70 years, "God Save the King" is being sung at sports grounds across the United Kingdom as tributes to Queen Elizabeth II continue two days after her death.

entries.title: The real-life drama behind filming locations for 'Stranger Things,' 'Ted Lasso,' 'Only Murders in the Building' and other Emmy favorites
entries.description: What do a pub in London, a 113-year-old apartment building in New York City, a former mental hospital in Atlanta, a luxury resort in Hawaii, a sprawling office complex in New Jersey and a mausoleum in one of the South's largest cemeteries have in common?

entries.title: Watch MUNA perform hit 'Silk Chiffon' on Amanpour
entries.description: MUNA perform a very special acoustic performance of their hit 'Silk Chiffon' on Amanpour.

entries.title: A Black retiree won money at a casino and is suing bank after she says she was turned away while trying to deposit a check
entries.description: A Michigan retiree is suing a Detroit bank after she says employees refused to cash a check she received from a casino after winning a jackpot.

entries.title: Cloud of colonialism: Queen Elizabeth's legacy in Africa
entries.description: The death of Queen Elizabeth II has prompted an outpouring of reflection and reaction online. But not all was grief -- some young Africans instead are sharing images and stories of their own elders, who endured a brutal period of British colonial history during the Queen's long reign.

entries.title: 'Chef's Table: Pizza' delivers some delicious content
entries.description: As far as I am concerned, we need more food content.

entries.title: Debunking myths about suicide helps encourage compassion and understanding
entries.description: Sometimes people who die by suicide get branded as selfish, depressed or attention-seeking.

entries.title: Watch: King Charles III publicly proclaimed as King
entries.description: The "Principal Proclamation" of King Charles III is read by Garter King of Arms on the balcony overlooking Friars' Court at St. James's Palace in London.

entries.title: Charles III is proclaimed King
How Serena Williams rewrote the playbook for female athletes juggling motherhood and sport
entries.description: When Serena Williams announced that she would "evolve away from tennis," she was pictured with her five-year-old daughter, Alexis Olympia Ohanian Jr.

entries.title: Watch King Charles III speak before formal proclamation
entries.description: The Accession Council ceremony in London's St. James's Palace officially proclaimed King Charles III as the UK's new monarch. The ceremony is being televised for the first time in history.

entries.title: Princeton University is now free for families making under $100,000
entries.description: The considerable cost of attending one of the top American universities will now be covered for students whose parents earn less than $100,000 per year.

entries.title: Travel news: Wild weather, clifftop hotels and all eyes on the UK
entries.description: In our travel roundup this week, we bring you lightning strikes, rainbow ice caves, clifftop hotels and tales of romance.

entries.title: Picturing the Queen: How artists portrayed Queen Elizabeth II through her reign
entries.description: It was one of those photogenic if historically insignificant moments when one (bona fide) icon fleetingly met another. Queen Elizabeth II met Marilyn Monroe at a London film premiere in 1956. The women probably had precious little in common aside from their age (both were then 30), global fame and glamour. A cameraman recorded the moment for posterity and, as luck would have it, Andy Warhol went on to make silkscreen prints of both women.

entries.title: Iga Swiatek vs. Ons Jabeur: Women's tennis' dominant forces clash in US Open final
entries.description: Tennis fans could not have asked for a more exciting or intriguing final than the one set to be served up at the US Open on Saturday.

entries.title: New reign: King Charles III to be proclaimed as monarch today
Ahed Tamimi's memoir is a call to action for all Gen Z to stand with Palestinians
entries.description: Ahed Tamimi rose to prominence in 2017 after a video of her slapping an Israeli soldier went viral, bringing renewed attention to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict -- especially Palestinian children living under Israeli military occupation.

entries.title: The Queen's life in numbers: Tallying an extraordinary reign

• King Charles III pays tribute to his 'darling mama' in first public address
• Who's who in the British royal family line of succession

entries.title: The Queen's life in numbers: Tallying an extraordinary reign
Welcome to the Cold War without the communism
entries.description: More than six months after the war on Ukraine started, the worldwide fracture it set off is hardening.

entries.title: Russia sends reinforcements to Kharkiv as Ukrainians advance
entries.description: Russia is reinforcing embattled military units in Kharkiv as it scrambles to counter a Ukrainian advance that has taken Kyiv's troops to the edge of two key cities in the region.

entries.title: Trump and Justice Department submit special master nominees to review Mar-a-Lago documents
entries.description: The Justice Department and former President Donald Trump's lawyers have submitted their proposals to a federal judge for who should serve as special master to review materials seized from Mar-a-Lago and how the process should work.

entries.title: Analysis: Ted Cruz nails something fundamental about Donald Trump and 2024
entries.description: Ted Cruz's relationship with Donald Trump has been, um, interesting to watch over the past few years.

entries.title: Video: From teasing presidents to 'skydiving': Queen Elizabeth II's funniest moments
entries.description: Queen Elizabeth II was no stranger to a good joke throughout her reign - doing everything from teasing sitting presidents to pretending to skydive into the Olympics. CNN's Randi Kaye looks back at her funniest moments.

entries.title: To UK PM: King overheard saying the death of his mother was 'moment I've been dreading'
